title: Turing reduction
summary: In computability theory, a Turing reduction from a decision problem A {\displaystyle A} to a decision problem B {\displaystyle B} is an oracle machine which decides problem A {\displaystyle A} given an oracle for B {\displaystyle B} (Rogers 1967, Soare 1987). It can be understood as an algorithm that could be used to solve A {\displaystyle A} if it had available to it a subroutine for solving B. The concept can be analogously applied to function problems.
